# The Complete Load Testing Platform
Artillery is a scalable, flexible and easy-to-use platform that contains everything you need for production-grade load testing.
[Get started — free](https://artillery.io/<https:/app.artillery.io/>)[Talk to sales](https://artillery.io/<https:/cal.com/team/artillery/30m>)

## Powering load testing at industry-leading companies
![IA Interactive](https://artillery.io/images/logos/ia-interactive.svg)![Amity](https://artillery.io/images/logos/amity.svg)![Gymshark](https://artillery.io/images/logos/gymshark.svg)![Big Give](https://artillery.io/images/logos/big-give.svg)![Brave](https://artillery.io/images/logos/brave.svg)![Housing.Cloud](https://artillery.io/images/logos/housing-cloud.svg)![Evervault](https://artillery.io/images/logos/evervault.svg)
## Everything you need for production-grade load testing
### Distributed load testing
Artillery can scale out your load tests with serverless load generators that run in your own AWS or Azure account. There is no long-lived infrastructure for you to set up or manage.
[Learn more](https://artillery.io/</docs/load-testing-at-scale>)
### Load test anything
Load test web apps, HTTP APIs, GraphQL services, WebSockets, Socket.IO, SOAP, gRPC, Kafka, and more.
[Learn more](https://artillery.io/</docs/get-started/why-artillery#what-kinds-of-services-can-i-test-with-artillery>)
### Load test with Playwright
Launch thousands of headless browsers with Playwright code. See how your web app handles high load, and the impact on Core Web Vitals.
[Learn more](https://artillery.io/</docs/reference/engines/playwright>)
### Reporting & collaboration
Visualize test results, share reports, analyze performance trends, and collaborate with your team.
[Get started](https://artillery.io/<https:/app.artillery.io/>)
### Lots of integrations
20+ integrations and plugins for monitoring, observability (including OpenTelemetry), CI/CD, and IDEs (VS Code, WebStorm, etc).
[Learn more](https://artillery.io/</docs/resources/integrations>)
### Scalable and cost-efficient
Artillery executes tests in your own AWS or Azure account, which is is orders of magnitude cheaper than running tests on a hosted platform. It’s serverless, so you only pay for what you use, and there is no infrastructure to manage.
[Learn more](https://artillery.io/</docs/load-testing-at-scale>)
## Lots of Integrations
[OpenTelemetryOpenTelemetry](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/publish-metrics/opentelemetry>)[GitHub ActionsGitHub Actions](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/guides/integration-guides/github-actions>)[DatadogDatadog](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/publish-metrics/datadog>)[SlackSlack](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/slack>)[Azure DevOpsAzure DevOps](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/guides/integration-guides/azure-devops>)[AWS CodeBuildAWS CodeBuild](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/guides/integration-guides/aws-codebuild>)[InfluxDBInfluxDB](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/publish-metrics/influxdb>)[Gitlab CI/CDGitlab CI/CD](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/guides/integration-guides/gitlab-ci-cd>)[CircleCICircleCI](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/guides/integration-guides/circleci>)[LightstepLightstep](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/publish-metrics/lightstep>)[StatsdStatsd](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/publish-metrics/statsd>)[HoneycombHoneycomb](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/publish-metrics/honeycomb>)[JenkinsJenkins](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/guides/integration-guides/jenkins>)[MixpanelMixpanel](https://artillery.io/<https:/www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/publish-metrics/mixpanel>)[Browse all ↗](https://artillery.io/</docs/resources/integrations>)
## Frequently Asked Questions
Does Artillery Cloud execute our tests?
All of your team’s tests run in your own AWS or Azure account, with all of the cost, security, and governance benefits that brings.
Artillery takes care of creating and managing all the necessary cloud infrastructure to execute your tests. The setup is quick, and you only pay for what you use. There is no long-running infrastructure to manage.
Hosted load runners are on our roadmap. If you’d like early access, please get in touch on sales@artillery.io
What’s the pricing model?
Artillery Cloud offers a free plan for teams just starting with load testing, or teams working on an internal proof-of-concept project.
For teams running continuous load tests on production apps, prices start at **$499/month**.
We support a variety of payment methods (card, invoice, ACH) and are launching an AWS Marketplace offering soon.
Please get in touch on sales@artillery.io if you have any questions.
Can we run Artillery Cloud in our VPC?
Yes, we offer an Enterprise subscription plan with the ability to run Artillery Cloud in your own VPC. Please [book a discovery call](https://artillery.io/<https:/cal.com/team/artillery/30m>) to discuss requirements and request a pricing quote.
## The Artillery Manifesto
It’s time for a rethink.
**Load testing as practiced today does not work.**
As engineers, we want to build fast, reliable, and scalable systems that serve our users.
Traffic spikes, new code deployments, new features, and new dependencies can all cause production problems. **Load testing is one of the most effective tools for keeping our apps fast and reliable.** And yet, we often leave load testing until it’s too late, and cross our fingers & hope for the best.
Why is that? **The tools fail us**. Clunky, antiquated, and hard to use. Open source tools that require managing non-trivial infrastructure to test at scale. Commercial tools that are so expensive you end up load testing once a quarter.
Companies like AWS, Netflix and Slack invest into internal load testing platforms to make load testing **as easy as unit and integration testing**. Most teams did not have access to such tools - until Artillery.
**Artillery is a fresh take on load testing** , informed by years of experience of production engineering and SRE. Modern load testing should be easy to get started with. It should be cloud-native and serverless, so that you can **forget about infrastructure** , and just run your load tests, **at any scale**. It should be designed for **continuous testing** , and integrate with your entire CI/CD and observability stack.
With Artillery we’re building a world-class load testing platform for everybody. We want every developer team to be able to go from **zero to production-scale testing, fast**.
Load testing the way it should be in 2025.
Artillery
Keep production reliable, customers happy, and pagers silent.

### Artillery: Revolutionizing Load Testing for the Modern Era

**Overview**  
Founded in 2021 and based in Limerick, Ireland, Artillery is a rising star in the realm of DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). This company emerged from Y Combinator's S21 batch, and it’s carving out a unique niche in the tech landscape.

**Mission**  
Artillery's mission is straightforward yet ambitious: to create a modern testing platform optimized for DevOps and SRE practices, aiming to make load testing accessible, scalable, and efficient.

**What They Do**  
Initially, Artillery began as a comprehensive load testing platform designed for continuous testing. Its standout feature allows users to run load tests from their own AWS account without the burden of infrastructure management. This approach has garnered the attention of thousands of developer teams, helping them maintain fast and reliable production systems.

**Key Features**  
- **Scalable and Serverless:** Artillery leverages serverless load generators to execute tests within your AWS or Azure environment, ensuring cost-effectiveness as users only pay for what they use.
- **Comprehensive Testing Capabilities:** It can test web applications, APIs, GraphQL services, WebSockets, and more—encompassing a wide range of use cases.
- **Easy Integration:** With over 20 integrations available, including for popular CI/CD tools and monitoring services, Artillery fits smoothly into existing workflows.
- **Continuous Testing Focus:** The platform is built for continuous testing, allowing developer teams to keep their systems resilient through regular load checks.

**Current Landscape**  
Artillery is quite small, with a tight-knit team of five, and showcases a flexible work environment. Aaron Epstein serves as their Group Partner, providing guidance and strategic direction.

**Why Artillery Matters**  
In a world where traffic spikes and new code deployments can jeopardize service reliability, traditional load testing methods often fall short. Artillery is addressing these gaps by offering a tool that is not only easy to use but also robust enough to facilitate real-time testing. It’s a fresh take on load testing informed by hands-on experience in production engineering.

**The Future Vision**  
Artillery aims to redefine the load testing landscape so that teams can go from zero to production-scale testing rapidly. By advocating for a culture where load testing is as routine as unit testing, Artillery is working towards a future where robust application performance is a standard expectation rather than a gamble.

For more information, visit [Artillery’s official site](https://artillery.io). Here’s to keeping production systems reliable, customers happy, and — most importantly — reducing pager duty calls!
